intro: Streptanthera lineata, commonly known as the slender fairybell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant features whorled, lanceolate leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Streptanthera lineata is often found in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in rich, well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ecologically important member of its habitat.
